summary: This is an email chain from June 27, 2019, discussing coordination for the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein. The participants, including an FBI SSA and a Chief of the Public Corruption Unit from the SDNY, plan to meet on Monday to finalize arrest and approach plans, noting an arrest warrant is expected by Tuesday.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: FBI agent involved in planning the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein, suggesting a meeting time of 3:30 PM on Monday.

persons.name: Chief
persons.role: Chief, Public Corruption Unit, United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the SDNY who initiated the email chain to coordinate a meeting regarding the arrest warrant and approach plans for Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Collaborating on planning the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein, as evidenced by their email coordination for a meeting.

events.title: Email coordination for Epstein arrest planning
events.description: Email chain discussing plans to meet on Monday to coordinate the arrest and approach for Jeffrey Epstein, with an arrest warrant expected by Tuesday.

events.title: Expected arrest warrant for Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The email indicates an arrest warrant for Jeffrey Epstein is expected to be in hand by Tuesday, July 2, 2019.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY (United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: An arrest warrant for Jeffrey Epstein was anticipated to be secured by Tuesday, July 2, 2019.
Law enforcement officials from the FBI and the SDNY Public Corruption Unit were coordinating a meeting on Monday, July 1, 2019, to plan the arrest and approach.
The email chain is dated June 27, 2019, indicating active, pre-arrest planning by federal authorities.
The correspondence involves high-level officials: an FBI Special Supervisory Agent (SSA) and the Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the SDNY.
